definition[0]: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found
example[0]: Tickets are available from the box office.
example[1]: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available.
example[2]: Further building can continue when money is made available.
example[3]: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
example[4]: Parking is readily available near the station entrance.
example[5]: Not enough data is available to scientists.
example[6]: Funds are available to assist teachers who want to attend the conference.
example[7]: No figures are available for the number of goods sold.
example[8]: There are plenty of jobs available in the area.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say that a book, record etc is out rather than available:
example[9]: His new album is out now.
definition[1]: someone who is available is not busy and has enough time to talk to you
example[10]: Collins was not available for comment on Thursday night.
definition[2]: someone who is available does not have a wife, boyfriend etc, and therefore may want to start a new romantic relationship with someone else
example[11]: Luckily a house soon became available for us.
example[12]: With the Internet it is possible to make learning available wherever it is needed.
example[13]: The material used was cheap and readily available.
example[14]: Organic food is now widely available.
example[15]: We use the best available technology.
example[16]: One small tree was the only available protection from the sun.
example[17]: Ruth sat down in the nearest available armchair.
example[18]: You should practise speaking the language at every available opportunity.
definition[3]: if something is available, you can buy it, get it, or use it
example[19]: Are there any tickets still available for Saturday?
example[20]: There’s no room for more books – we’ve used up all the available space.
definition[4]: if a seat or room is free, it is not being used by anyone
example[21]: Excuse me, is this seat free?
example[22]: The hotel never has any free rooms over the Christmas period.
definition[5]: if a house or room is vacant, it is available for someone to use or rent
example[23]: If you’re looking for somewhere to rent, I think there’s a vacant apartment in my building.
example[24]: I’ll ask around and see if there’s a room vacant somewhere.
example[25]: The sign on the toilet said ‘vacant’.
definition[6]: a spare room, key, tyre etc is one that you have in addition to the ones that you normally use, and is therefore available to be used
example[26]: We have a spare room you can stay in.
example[27]: There’s a spare key in this drawer.
example[28]: I got the spare tyre out of the back of the car.
definition[7]: an empty room, building etc has no one in it
example[29]: The house was empty for two months before it was sold.
example[30]: They have three empty rooms now that the kids have moved out.
definition[8]: if something is on offer, it is available for people to choose from
example[31]: There is a huge network of cycle tracks on offer.
example[32]: Other facilities on offer in this excellent hotel include a hairdressing salon, a coffee shop, and a children's play room.
example[33]: the variety of delicious fruits on offer
definition[9]: if a seat or room is taken, it is not available for other people to use, because someone has already arranged to use it
example[34]: I’m sorry – that seat is taken.
example[35]: I’m afraid all our rooms are taken at the moment.
definition[10]: able to be bought, used, seen etc
example[36]: They plan to make the product widely available in vending machines.
definition[11]: if someone is available, they are not busy and can see or talk to people
example[38]: I’m afraid the chairman isn’t available at the moment.
example[39]: Are you available for a meeting next Wednesday?
